meanings.def: something that causes great physical or mental pain
examples: the miseries of unemployment
the sheer misery of homelessness
the country's economic misery

meanings.def: a person who is always unhappy and complaining
examples: Don't be such an old misery!
Old misery guts here doesn’t want to go out.

meanings.def: to behave in a way that makes somebody else feel very unhappy
examples: My old boss used to make my life a misery.
His constant criticism made her life a misery.

meanings.def: to kill a creature because it has an illness or injury that cannot be treated
examples: In the end we asked the vet to put the poor creature out of its misery.

meanings.def: to stop somebody worrying by telling them something that they are anxious to know
examples: Put me out of my misery—did I pass or didn't I?
Oh, put her out of her misery—tell her who won.
